abstract.p: DoubleClick will acquire NetCreations, provider of e-mail marketing services, for about $191 million (S)

block.p: The Internet advertising company DoubleClick said yesterday that it would acquire NetCreations, a provider of e-mail marketing services, for about $191 million. NetCreations stockholders will receive 0.41 share of DoubleClick common stock for each share of NetCreations common stock, representing a price of $12.15 a share. The deal serves as something of a double play for DoubleClick, which last week agreed to purchase AtPlan, an online market research company, for $120 million in stock and cash. The New York-based DoubleClick provides technology and services that allow publishers and advertisers to manage and track their Internet advertising campaigns.
